comments.body:
It seems like most of these tests were copied from material/text_field_test.dart.  Instead, would it be possible to reuse the code by passing something like a `useSelectableText` flag?  This has the added benefit of making it obvious that TextField and SelectableText need to have the exact same selection behavior.  In the future when someone needs to add or edit a test in TextField, or change its behavior, they will be more likely to realize that they need to do the same for SelectableText, and vice versa.  If you had to heavily modify many of these tests then maybe it's not possible, but if not it could be a big improvement.

Another thing I want to ask about is test coverage for selection on iOS.  Is there thorough coverage for the iOS selection behavior and appearance for SelectableText?  Is there any way we can also work to guarantee that it's in sync with TextField and CupertinoTextField selection behavior?

yes there are a good portion of ios coverage in this file. As we discussed offline, I have to rewrite a lot of  the tests since there are layout/semantics/selection difference between selectabletext and text field, it will be hard to combine the test. In the future i plan to factor out selection, I should be able to refactor and combine the test as well.

Add a line after this one to make sure the test fails if the assert is removed:
```dart
    fail('An assert should be triggered when minLines is greater than maxLines');
```
You can check to see if it properly fails by removing the assert from your code and seeing if the test case fails
Add a `return;` after this line to make sure the failure is not hit if the `AssertionError` is correctly triggered.

I don't know why this test was passing in the first place, but it started failing when I made this change, despite the behavior it describes being broken either way.  I've created the issue https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/64059 to deal with fixing it and unskipping it.

So this test was failing because it attempts to drag the selection onto the white space following a word.

Take 'Atwater Peel Sherbrooke Bonaventure', if we select 'Atwater' and try to drag the selection over the white space following it, then the selection will skip the whitespace and drag onto the next word. I checked this behavior on uneditable text on iOS and it looks like it is consistent. Though I'm not sure if this is the desired behavior.

I verified the behavior by modifying the same test found under `cupertino/text_field_test.dart`, and changing its values to mimic the drag from the test found in `widgets/selectable_text_test.dart`. With the same selection and drag `cupertino/text_field_test.dart` also fails.

Indeed on master I see that I cannot drag the selection handle after selecting a word to select the space after it, on both a TextField and a SelectableText.  It jumps into the next word.  Maybe we're not detecting the drag gesture soon enough?

On native iOS I am able to select the space, so this seems like something that should be fixed (but not related to this PR).

I don't see how this test was able to pass in the first place, but if it now mimics a test in CupertinoTextField then I guess it's ok for now?
Yeah i'm not sure how it still passed. I also checked the behavior on master and came to the same conclusion you did.
why only test for macOS and iOS?
This was done to be consistent with the other double tap tests in this file that were specifying macOS/iOS
